com.yantra.api.inv

Interface updateFutureInventory

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.INVApi, YIFApi

    public interface updateFutureInventory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document updateFutureInventory(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The updateFutureInventory API is used by suppliers for recording or updating information about incoming inventory such as purchase orders.

    • Method Detail

      • updateFutureInventory

        org.w3c.dom.Document updateFutureInventory(YFSEnvironment env,
                                           org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                           java.rmi.RemoteException
        The updateFutureInventory API is used by suppliers for recording or updating information about incoming inventory such as purchase orders.

        Note: To use the updateFutureInventory API to remove the PO, do not pass the Augment\SupplyDetails element of the input XML. Onhand supply can not be removed using this API.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetTagNoUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        Future inventory is updated.

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Additional Information:
        API throws error if availability is maintained externally for primary enterprise code of inventory organization or ShipNode.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        Null.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
